metadata.title: Convert Turns to Degrees – Angle Converter
metadata.description: Convert rotations from Turns to Degrees, useful for interpreting rotational motion in degrees.

introduction: This converter transforms turns to degrees for angle interpretation.
Rotational motion in turns converts to degrees for detailed specification.
This converter uses the relationship where 1 turn equals 360 degrees.
methodology: 360° = 1 turn. To convert turns to degrees, multiply by 360.
Degrees provide familiar angle measurement for rotation specification.
Understanding turn-to-degree conversion is essential for mechanical design.
This converter provides precise angle conversion.

faqs.question: Why convert turns to degrees?
faqs.answer: Turns natural for rotation count. Degrees familiar for angle specification.

faqs.question: How do mechanical systems use turns?
faqs.answer: Rotation count. Motor shaft: 10 turns = 10 complete rotations.

faqs.question: What's the relationship to RPM?
faqs.answer: RPM = turns per minute. 300 RPM = 300 turns/minute.

faqs.question: Can I mix turns and degrees?
faqs.answer: Yes, but convert to same unit. 2 turns + 90° = 720° + 90° = 810°.

faqs.question: What's angular displacement?
faqs.answer: Total rotation amount. Measured in turns, degrees, or radians.

faqs.question: How do I calculate gear ratios?
faqs.answer: Input turns / Output turns = Gear ratio. 2 input turns = 1 output turn = 2:1 ratio.

faqs.question: What's periodic motion?
faqs.answer: Motion repeating every fixed angle/time. 1 period = 1 turn = 360°.
